alert.note: Alert for Amador; Calaveras; El Dorado; Nevada; Placer (California) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Warning issued January 01 at 4:41AM PST by NWS Sacramento
info.description: .Rain has ended across the region, however runoff from heavy rain on Saturday continues to work its way downstream. Local gages indicate that most streams and creeks have crested and are beginning to slowly recede, but many remain above flood stage. Dry weather will continue today allowing creeks and streams to recede further. Many area roads remain closed due to flooding. Do NOT drive around barricades! Water is often deeper and flowing faster than it may appear. Your life, first responders lives, and damage to your vehicle are not worth the risk!. ...FLOOD WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 10 AM PST THIS MORNING... * WHAT...Urban and small stream flooding caused by runoff from excessive rainfall yesterday continues. * WHERE...Portions of central and northern California, including the following counties, in central California, Placer. In northern California, Amador, Calaveras, El Dorado, Nevada, Sacramento, San Joaquin, Solano, Stanislaus, Sutter, Tuolumne, Yolo and Yuba. * WHEN...Until 1000 AM PST. * IMPACTS...Flooding of rivers, creeks, streams, and other low-lying and flood-prone locations continues. Numerous roads remain closed due to flooding. Low-water crossings are inundated with water and may not be passable. Expect many areas of slow moving or standing water.
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Be especially cautious at night when it is harder to recognize the dangers of flooding.

area.areaDesc: Amador; Calaveras; El Dorado; Nevada; Placer
